channel.title: engineering on Duy Do
channel.description: Recent content in engineering on Duy Do

item.title: Understanding Elasticsearch deleting data flow
item.description:
How is a document deleted from Elasticsearch? The following diagram shows data flow behinds the scene of deleting a single document.

Elasticsearch Deleting Data Flow

item.title: Understanding Elasticsearch indexing data flow
item.description:
When a document is stored in Elasticsearch, it is indexed and fully searchable within 1 second. Elasticsearch uses an inverted index data structure that supports full-text searches efficiently and very fast.

Elasticsearch Indexing Data Flow

item.title: Java: Type Promotion
item.description: Cách đây khá lâu mình đem đoạn mã đơn giản bên dưới hỏi một số bạn làm Java, cả juniors và seniors, tất cả các bạn đều bảo rằng đoạn mã này không có vấn đề gì, biên dịch và chạy được. 1 2 byte b = 1; b = b * 2; Thật ra thì đoạn mã trên không thể biên dịch được. Trước tiên thử phân tích xem vì sao các bạn trả lời như vậy.

item.title: EVM - Elasticsearch Version Manager
item.description: As an Elasticsearch consultant, I often work with different versions of Elasticsearch. To make my developer life easier, I created evm. It allows me to install, remove, test multiple versions easily.

item.title: Solve your search and analytics problems with Elasticsearch
item.description: I gave a talk about Elasticsearch at Barcamp Saigon 2016. We’d discussed how to apply Elasticsearch to solve search and analytics problems, how Elasticsearch has been used at GitHub, Uber and Sentifi. https://speakerdeck.com/duydo/solve-your-search-and-analytics-problems-with-elasticsearch

item.title: How Elasticsearch cluster works
item.description:
This post is part of a series covering the architecture of Elasticsearch based on my experience while working with it. In this post, we’ll be discussing how the cluster works, try to find answers for following questions:

  • How a node in cluster talks to others?
  • What happens when a node joins or leaves the cluster?
  • What happens when a node stops or has encountered a problem?

item.title: Celery - a Distributed Task Queue
item.description: I gave a talk about Celery when working at Sentifi.

item.title: Spring 3 + JPA 2.0 + Hibernate 3.5.1-Final + Wicket 1.4.9 + Maven 2
item.description: This is just a quick note for someone wants to use Spring 3, Jpa 2, Hibernate 3 and Wicket within Maven 2 project.

item.title: Effective JPA with Enumeration
item.description:
How to persist an enumeration effectively? Here is my experience.

I will use Wordpress for example. We all know that every post in Wordpress blog system has a status with possible values: draft, pending-review, published…

item.title: Install Thrift on Ubuntu
item.description: A quick note for installing Thrift on Ubuntu.

item.title: Fluent Interface
item.description:
I’ve played with my own framework recently, I found a new term, called “Fluent Interface”. There is a great article of Martin Fowler about this term, you can read it if you have not heard about it yet.

The idea of “Fluent Interface” is instead of returning void in setter methods of an object, returning an object to promote object chaining.

item.title: Liferay Portal 4.3 Final Released
item.description: Liferay Portal 4.3 Final was released yesterday. At work, I have to develop a server communicate with mobile device based-on Liferay portal. I’m very pleasure with this version of Liferay, mobile device is supported :-).

item.title: Google Desktop & Picasa for Linux
item.description: I’m very glad to know these softwares are supported for Linux. I love Google products, they’re simple but powerful :). Below is instructions for setting up these softwares on Fedora and Ubuntu (I only know these distros :D)

item.title: Autostart Programs On Linux
item.description: Bài viết này nhằm cung cấp các cách để chương trình có thể khởi động ngay sau khi chúng ta đăng nhập vào hệ thống Linux (autostart programs).
